body_html:
I was trying this LSTM example (and some others from the repository):
https://github.com/yunjey/pytorch-tutorial/blob/master/tutorials/02-intermediate/recurrent_neural_network/main.py

I tried building pytorch from source. Somehow it was extremely slow after this (I'm using an virtual server with vCores, maybe the script got confused by virtual hardware?) so I went back to using the pip installation (0.3.1).
When using two threads, performance seems to be slightly better than default.

I tried building pytorch from source. Somehow it was extremely slow after this (I'm using an virtual server with vCores, maybe the script got confused by virtual hardware?) so I went back to using the pip installation (0.3.1).
When using two threads, performance seems to be slightly better than default.
body:
I was trying this LSTM example (and some others from the repository):
https://github.com/yunjey/pytorch-tutorial/blob/master/tutorials/02-intermediate/recurrent_neural_network/main.py



I tried building pytorch from source. Somehow it was extremely slow after this (I'm using an virtual server with vCores, maybe the script got confused by virtual hardware?) so I went back to using the pip installation (0.3.1). 
When using two threads, performance seems to be slightly better than default.
